name: Introduction to Engineering
description: This course introduces students to the engineering field and provides a foundation for further study.

name: Engineering Mathematics
description: This course introduces students to mathematical concepts and techniques essential for engineering.

name: Engineering Mechanics I
description: This course introduces students to the fundamental principles of engineering mechanics, including statics and dynamics.

name: Engineering Mechanics II
description: This course builds on the concepts learned in Engineering Mechanics I and introduces students to more advanced concepts, such as kinematics and vibration.

name: Biomedical Engineering I
description: This course introduces students to the anatomy and physiology of the human body and the basic principles of biomedical engineering.

name: Biomedical Engineering II
description: This course builds on the concepts learned in Biomedical Engineering I and introduces students to more advanced topics, such as medical imaging, bioinstrumentation, and biomaterials.
